Title: European Parliament adopts flexible gas storage refill targets
Description: The European Parliament has approved the European Commission’s proposal to extend the EU’s gas storage scheme until the end of 2027, to reduce the refilling target from 90% to 83%, and extend the deadline by a month.
Author: JS

Title: US–Houthi truce may spur LNG flows via Red Sea and Suez Canal; gradual recovery expected
Description: A recent ceasefire between the US and Yemen’s Houthi rebels could pave the way for a recovery in LNG shipping through the Red Sea and Suez Canal. But any rebound in flows is expected to be slow and tentative, with Houthi leaders maintaining that Israeli-linked vessels remain targets.
Author: CK

Title: Thailand advances Alaska LNG talks, eyes 3–5 mtpa long-term offtake, investment
Description: Thailand is stepping up negotiations over potential investment and long-term offtake of 3–5 mtpa of LNG from the proposed 20 mtpa Alaska LNG project in Nikiski, as part of a broader strategy to secure low-carbon fuel for its growing power demand and energy transition. The Ministry of Energy confirmed the talks following a high-level visit to Alaska on May 6.
Author: CK

Title: Germany, Egas strike deal to deploy Energos Power FSRU in Egypt; installation expected in July
Description: Germany’s Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Climate Action (BMWK) has sub-chartered the Energos Power floating storage regasification unit (FSRU) to Egypt’s state-owned Egyptian Natural Gas Holding Co. (Egas) in a move expected to help meet Egypt's growing  gas demand.
Author: CK
